name: Hakam-Hiccup Cocktail
note: Recipe from the Hakam-Hiccup Bar, Eastbourne.

name: Havowon Cocktail
note: Recipe by "Jock" Melville, Bartender, 500 Club, Albemarle Street, London.

name: Happy Youth Cocktail
instruction: Put ice, orange juice, and cherry brandy in a wineglass. Fill with Champagne.
note: Recipe by Charlie Soumille, New York Bar, Paris.

name: Harry's Cocktail
instruction: Shake well, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve with a stuffed Olive.

name: Harry's Pick-me-up
instruction: Shake well, strain into a medium-sized wineglass, and fill with Champagne.

name: Hasty Cocktail
instruction: Shake well and strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Heering Cherisher
instruction: Shake with cracked ice and serve in a cocktail glass with a cherry.

name: Hoffman House Cocktail
instruction: Shake well, strain into a cocktail glass, and squeeze Orange Peel on top.

name: Homestead Cocktail
instruction: Shake well and strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Hooney Cocktail
note: Recipe by N. H. Billy Fawcett, Minneapolis.

name: Horse's Neck
instruction: Put lemon peel, ice, and sugar in a large tumbler. Add brandy and fill with ginger ale.

name: Hot Egg Nogg
instruction: Beat egg and sugar. Add boiling milk while stirring. Add brandy and rum, stir, and grate nutmeg on top.
note: Use a bar spoon to prevent the glass from cracking.

name: Hot Grog
instruction: Dissolve sugar and lemon juice in hot water. Add brandy, rum, cloves, and cinnamon. Fill with hot water, add lemon slice, and grate nutmeg on top.

name: Hurricane
instruction: Stir and strain. Garnish with Lemon Peel.
note: Recipe by the author at Café de Paris, London, 1941.
